verbose_text: The conventional breeding protocols designed for reducing phytic acid content, rely on the isolation of low phytic acid (lpa) mutations impairing the biosynthesis or the storage of phytic acid in the seed; the increased P and mineral cation bioavailability in the lpa mutant seeds so far isolated was confirmed by nutritional trials [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
